plugins.name: Icon Resizer
plugins.description:
Icon Resizer saves you time in properly preparing icons for use in your design in the following ways:


  • Quickly add/remove icon dimensions;
  • Ability to generate both individual icons and a grid of variants;
  • Set stroke thickness to frame the size of the icon if it uses outlines;
  • You have a root icon component that allows you to make changes in only one place to edit the entire set;
  • Quickly rename icon components using variables.


Pro features [BUY PRO‚Üó]:

You can set your own price for PRO features. I tried to make this plugin as affordable as possible and really appreciate if you were able to set your price above the minimum price. It helps to recoup the development costs.


  • Preserving the fill color when changing instances of different icons. Now you don't have to re-set the color for an icon every time. This is achieved through proper automatic organization of layers;
  • Analysis of icons for correct structure matching and quick selection;
  • Automatic cleaning of unnecessary nesting within the icon frame.


How to use? SEE GUIDE‚Üó


  1. Select one or more icons you want to generate;
  2. Enter a name for the set to be generated (use variables to pass dimensionality values or the original name, this will apply according to the frame size);
  3. Select the type of generation. As individual components or as a variants set;
  4. Set the desired icon sizes and stroke thickness if needed;
  5. Click the "Generate" button.
plugins.tagline: Quickly create sets of icon components of the required size

plugins.name: Reader
plugins.description:
Reader makes it easier to summarize articles, understand code in simple terms, and shorten large chunks of text. To use Reader:


  1. Select text layer(s) > Right click > Plugins > Reader
  2. Enter your key or sign up for beta
  3. Enter the details of what you want read
  4. Click Read and summarize text will be applied


Reader is currently in beta. To request access, please visit: https://tryreader.app/

plugins.name: Noise Effect Generator
plugins.description:
Noise Effect Generator is a powerful Figma plugin that helps designers easily add high-quality noise and texture effects to layers.

Key Features:

‚Ä¢ Multiple noise types: Particle Flow, Striped, Radial Waves, Maze, Spots, Fiber, Pixelated, Diffusion, Waveform, and Geometric

‚Ä¢ Rich adjustment options: frequency, amplitude, density, rotation, and many other parameters

‚Ä¢ Amplitude effect adjustments: Normal, Ridge, Wave, Contrast, and Threshold

‚Ä¢ Geometry types: Triangle, Square, Circle, Diamond, Line, and Dot

‚Ä¢ Highly customizable color mapping system with gradient support

‚Ä¢ 15 beautiful preset templates you can apply with one click

‚Ä¢ Real-time preview - what you see is what you get

‚Ä¢ Multi-language support (Chinese, English, and Japanese)

Whether you want to add texture to illustrations, add depth to backgrounds, or create unique artistic effects, the Noise Effect Generator plugin makes it easy.
plugins.tagline: Add high-quality noise, textures and artistic effects to your designs

plugins.name: Copy waste more
plugins.description:
Copy paste layer properties

1. select layer
2. run copy to get its properties
3. select another layer
4. apply one of the following:

- width
- height
- position
- size
- layer name
- x (align left) 
- align right
- y (align top)
- align bottom
- scale to align left
- scale to align right
- scale to align top
- scale to align bottom

Tipp
You can either use the panel (Show panel) or the menu commands (which allows you to set system-shortcuts)

Greatly improves the workflow of repeated copy paste tasks.

plugins.name: Super Clone - Copy or Clone elements in to multiple frames ( support autolayout)
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you to copy an object into multiple frames in a click. The copied object preserves its position at the destination frames. Meaning, they get copied at the same position as they were in the source frame. This works for both simple and auto-layout frames.



Why did I develop this? 


The thought for this plugin came from personal frustration :) In Figma, I saw that sometimes we wouldn‚Äôt be able to drag a new object or an icon into a frame. The object will stay outside the frame somewhere. Then we got to hold the object, and drag through several frames in the sidebar ( our frames usually have the same names making it even tougher)) and then push them into the frame wants. I wanted to have a simple plugin that will just show me a list of frames and then copy the selected object into the selected frame. 


As I started developing this, the idea extrapolated from copying to ‚Äúsingle frame‚Äù to copying to ‚Äú multiple frames‚Äù.  First, the idea was to do this for simple frames only, but then that thought also evolved into supporting auto layout frames as well.


What can the plugin do?


  • If the frame sizes are similar, the copied object ( in the source frame) preserves its position in the destination frame also 
  • Simple frames, auto layout frames, and child frames are supported.  Copied object preserves its position in the auto layout also.
  • If you copy a component into multiple frames it will get copied as a child instance at the destination frames.
plugins.tagline: Copy or clone elements or components in to multiple frame with a click

plugins.name: Page Numbers for Slides (Paginate)
plugins.description:
Add beautiful, customizable slide numbers ‚Äî in seconds.

This plugin automatically adds page numbers to your slides with full control over style and layout.

Save your settings as templates and reuse them later. No more repetitive setup!


‚ú® Bonus: Magic Mode

Let the plugin detect slide background and adjust text color automatically ‚Äî for perfect contrast every time.


‚ú® Exclude specific slides

Skip page numbers on selected slides without breaking the sequence. Edit this setting directly in your templates.


Features:


  1. Auto-pagination for your slide frames
  2. Customize font, color, position, opacity
  3. Skip specific slides from pagination
  4. Save and reuse templates
  5. Magic Mode: auto-adjusts text color based on background
  6. Lightweight, fast, and easy to use


Perfect for pitch decks, reports, and any slide-based designs.
plugins.tagline: pagination  slides  presentation  page numbers  template  auto layout  productivity  deck  tools

plugins.name: m3-variable-exporter
plugins.description:
With this plugin you can export figma variables or paint styles created by the Material Theme Builder as css variables in accordance with the M3 design token specification. It exports the variable groups "Schemes", "Palettes" and "Extended Colors" and ignores the others. Optional export of text styles is possible. You can also suffix the color variables with either "-dark" or "-light", or use the mode/theme as suffix.


The created output looks like this (example is shortened):


/* material-theme.light.tokens.scss */

.light {
    --md-sys-color-primary: #65558f;
    --md-sys-color-surface-tint: #65558f;
    --md-sys-color-on-primary: #ffffff;
    --md-sys-color-primary-container: #e9ddff;
    --md-sys-color-on-primary-container: #201047;
    --md-sys-color-secondary: #625b71;
    --md-sys-color-on-secondary: #ffffff;
    --md-sys-color-secondary-container: #e8def8;
    --md-sys-color-on-secondary-container: #1e192b;
    [...]
    --md-ref-palette-primary100: #ffffff;
    --md-ref-palette-primary99: #fffbff;
    --md-ref-palette-primary98: #fdf7ff;
    --md-ref-palette-primary95: #f6eeff;
    --md-ref-palette-primary90: #e9ddff;
    --md-ref-palette-primary80: #cfbcff;
    --md-ref-palette-primary70: #b69df7;
    --md-ref-palette-primary60: #9a83db;
    --md-ref-palette-primary50: #8069bf;
    --md-ref-palette-primary40: #6750a4;
    --md-ref-palette-primary35: #5b4397;
    --md-ref-palette-primary30: #4f378a;
    --md-ref-palette-primary25: #432b7e;
    --md-ref-palette-primary20: #381e72;
    --md-ref-palette-primary15: #2d1067;
    --md-ref-palette-primary10: #22005d;
    --md-ref-palette-primary5: #160041;
    --md-ref-palette-primary0: #000000;
    [...]
}

/* fonts.tokens.scss */

:root {
    --md-sys-typescale-display-large-font: Roboto;
    --md-sys-typescale-display-large-size: 57px;
    --md-sys-typescale-display-large-tracking: -0.25px;
    --md-sys-typescale-display-large-weight: Regular;
    --md-sys-typescale-display-medium-font: Roboto;
    --md-sys-typescale-display-medium-size: 45px;
    --md-sys-typescale-display-medium-tracking: 0px;
    --md-sys-typescale-display-medium-weight: Regular;
    [...]
}
plugins.tagline: Export Material Theme Builder figma variables to css variables

plugins.name: Apply string variable to prop
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to assign text variables to components and instances even if their text uses props.

Figma has planned this feature but who has the time to wait !


Instructions

Step 1 - Create a layer with the string variable you want, select it. Or select an existing one.


Step 2 - Select the text layers you want to apply the string variable to.


Step 3 - Run the plugin.

plugins.name: FigMayo
plugins.description:
What is FigMayo?


FigMayo instantly converts any Figma library into a fully functional documentation reference website you can share with your team. All your styles, variables and components are included allowing stakeholders to browse and explore your design work.


Give developers the tools they need to inspect components & variables, copy styles and play with your variants and props. Easily add Storybook, Github markdown, code samples and more.


You get a single source of truth for your team that is automatically kept up to date.


How to create a documentation site using FigMayo

  1. In Figma, go to the plugin menu and open the FigMayo plugin
  2. Sign up for a free account on www.figmayo.com
  3. Grab your API key from from your FigMayo settings
  4. Paste your API key into the plugin
  5. Paste the share url of your Figma library into the plugin
  6. Click the sync library button


Why use FigMayo?

  1. Quickly share your components, styles and variables with non-figma users, it‚Äôs the perfect developer handoff.
  2. Instant setup - no manual time spent replicating information that exists in Figma.
  3. Stay in sync - updates from your libraries can be quickly synced with your site.
  4. Consolidate product knowledge from Figma & Github.


Reach us on:

  1. LinkedIn
  2. Slack Community

accepted.name: Gavin McFarland
accepted.description: Freelance Designer and Developer who loves making things

plugins.name: Rename childs
plugins.description:
The plugin helps you to name sublayers easily.

What's the purpose of a plugin?

You might have many icons in your design system library, each of which has a different name for its child layer. When you swap the icons in one component instance, the color will not remain since the child layer names are different. This plugin solves this problem.


How does it work?

Select all the frames, lunch the plugin, give a name and click on the button. That is all. All the layers will change.

My name is Edward Chechique, I am a Product Designer who believes in designing and building with a team honest and simple products, with constant improvement to make people‚Äôs lives better.

plugins.name: Pixel perfect (Beta)
plugins.description:

Instantly align your designs to the pixel grid with a single click. This plugin fine-tunes the position and size of selected elements, ensuring crisp, clean layouts without manual adjustments.


Key features:

‚Ä¢ Recursively applies adjustments to selected layers and all their descendants

‚Ä¢ Aligns object positions and dimensions to whole pixels

‚Ä¢ Rounds stroke widths to the nearest 0.5 pixel

‚Ä¢ Respects auto layout constraints

‚Ä¢ Adjusts corner radii for pixel-perfect curves

‚Ä¢ Preserves your design intent while enhancing clarity


Achieve pixel-perfect designs effortlessly, saving time and maintaining consistency across your projects. Ideal for UI designers who value precision and clean visual output in their work.

plugins.description:
Select by Name is a powerful plugin for Figma that streamlines the process of selecting elements by their names. With just a few clicks, this plugin allows users to conveniently select all other elements on the current page that share the same name as the currently selected element.


When working on complex Figma projects with numerous elements, organizing and managing them efficiently becomes crucial. Whether you want to select all buttons, headings, or any other element type with a specific name, this plugin has got you covered.

plugins.name: Paginate ‚Äî Add page numbers in one click
plugins.description:
Helps you add page numbers to YOUR design in one click. Perfect for presentations, PDFs, and multi-page layouts.


How it works


Step 1. Name Your Text Layer

Use a specific layer name for your text, or copy the one the plugin suggests. The plugin will replace it with the page number.


Step 2. Arrange frames in a Z-pattern (left to right, then top to bottom).


Step 3. (Optional) Settings:

  1. Choose ascending or descending order
  2. Set starting number (e.g., 2,3,4 or 43,44,45)
  3. Increment numbers (e.g., 1,3,5 or 1,5,9)
  4. Define digit format (1,2,3 or 01,02,03)
  5. Select number type (Arabic numerals or Roman numerals)


Step 4. Select the frames that need page numbers. Click Paginate and watch your layers update instantly!



Additional Info:

Feedback, suggestions, and feature requests are welcome in comments!

Inspired by "PageNum" by Resul Celik, with added features.

accepted.name: Neha Gupta
accepted.description: An itch to solve problems and make lives better.

plugins.tagline: Smart page numbering for Figma layers in seconds

plugins.name: Font Variables Maker
plugins.description:
Typical situation: you've been playing around with fonts and at some point it's too late and too tedious to clean things up manually.


This plugin will help you clean up your typography. All you have to do is select text layers (and the plugin will help you with this), click a button and everything will be automatically sorted. A set of variables is generated based on the fonts used in the file and applied to all selected text layers in an orderly fashion.


Want to apply only 4 of the 20 fonts used? No problem. Want to change fonts within frames only? Easy. Want to apply a specific font to all text layers without variables? Yes, please.


With a single click, you can add control and order to your file. This is the kind of result art directors expect from designers.

plugins.name: SVG to Jetpack Compose Icon
plugins.description:
SVG to Jetpack Compose Icon is a powerful Figma plugin that converts vector graphics directly into Jetpack Compose ImageVector code. It's designed for Android and Kotlin Multiplatform developers who want to seamlessly integrate their Figma designs into Compose projects.

The plugin preserves all vector properties including colors, strokes, and complex paths while generating clean, production-ready Kotlin code. With features like debug mode and preview composables, it streamlines the workflow between designers and developers.


Key features:

  1. One-click conversion from SVG to Compose
  2. Maintains design fidelity with pixel-perfect accuracy
  3. Generates properly formatted Kotlin code
  4. Works with Compose Multiplatform
  5. Includes preview composables
  6. Debug mode for troubleshooting


Whether you're working on Android apps or cross-platform projects with Compose Multiplatform, this plugin helps bridge the gap between design and development, saving hours of manual vector conversion work.
plugins.tagline: Powerful plugin that converts vector graphics directly into Jetpack Compose ImageVector code.

117284.description:
SVG to Jetpack Compose Icon is a powerful Figma plugin that converts vector graphics directly into Jetpack Compose ImageVector code. It's designed for Android and Kotlin Multiplatform developers who want to seamlessly integrate their Figma designs into Compose projects.

The plugin preserves all vector properties including colors, strokes, and complex paths while generating clean, production-ready Kotlin code. With features like debug mode and preview composables, it streamlines the workflow between designers and developers.


Key features:

  1. One-click conversion from SVG to Compose
  2. Maintains design fidelity with pixel-perfect accuracy
  3. Generates properly formatted Kotlin code
  4. Works with Compose Multiplatform
  5. Includes preview composables
  6. Debug mode for troubleshooting


Whether you're working on Android apps or cross-platform projects with Compose Multiplatform, this plugin helps bridge the gap between design and development, saving hours of manual vector conversion work.
117284.tagline: Powerful plugin that converts vector graphics directly into Jetpack Compose ImageVector code.

plugins.name: Pagefleet
plugins.description:
The Purpose

Pagefleet is built to help you save time by instantly generating all necessary pages for your design project instead of having to create them one by one. It comes equipped with three diverse templates that have been tailored to suit small, medium, and large design projects. Whether you're working on a website design, mobile app or a robust e-commerce site, Pagefleet has got you covered. To add to its versatility, it includes a custom feature that allows you reuse and edit any of the prebuilt templates to match your requirements.


How to use Pagefleet


Quickstart

Begin by running the plugin. Under the 'Quickstart' tab, you can select the project type that resonates with your requirements. Upon selection, a pre-defined set of pages are generated instantly, setting the stage for you to dive into your project.


Custom

If you wish to customize one of the templates, navigate to the 'Custom' tab and select the template you'd like to reuse. Once your template is selected, you have the freedom to modify the names of the pages by simply clicking on them. After you've made your desired changes, click on 'Generate Pages' to produce your own custom set of pages.


Limitations

  • If you are running the plugin on a fresh Figma file, it will rename the current page you're at with the first name in the template.
  • If you already have a few pages setup, running the plugin will rename only the current page and append the rest of the pages below it.

plugins.name: Lingohub for Figma
plugins.description:
Localize all your Figma projects with Lingohub ‚Äî all your texts, in one place!


With Lingohub, you can seamlessly localize any project, from web or mobile apps to games or websites. Our continuous translation management and streamlined workflows integrate effortlessly into your development process.


How it works with our Figma plugin

‚Ä¢Push text segments from Figma directly to Lingohub.

‚Ä¢Pull completed translations back into Figma and instantly preview your localized designs.

‚Ä¢Context is key: screenshots of your designs are automatically uploaded to Lingohub, eliminating the need to add them manually.


What you can do with Lingohub

‚Ä¢Collaborate with multiple teams on localization.

‚Ä¢Automate your software localization tasks.

‚Ä¢Translate with our powerful, feature-rich editor (term base, translation memory, quality checks, and more).


For more details on using the Figma plugin, see our Help Center article.


A paid Lingohub account is required to use the Figma plugin. We offer a 14-day free trial so you can experience all features. Need help? Contact our support or schedule a free demo.
plugins.tagline: You create, Lingohub translates

plugins.name: Unfolding Variable
plugins.description:
Hello, I'm Kan, a Thai UX/UI Designer. This plugin is designed to make sharing design tokens a breeze. Feel free to give it a try and let me know what you think. Your feedback is valuable to me!


Highlights

  1. Generate token documents or JSON file effortlessly with a single click.
  2. Instantly unfold all tokens in your local variable into a detailed table.
  3. Get a lightning-fast overview of your local variable settings.
  4. Streamline your development process by converting local variables into highly usable JSON formats.
  5. Instantly check if a variable is in use ‚Äî just enter the variable name and see where it‚Äôs linked and on which pages

plugins.name: Themed
plugins.description:
Effortlessly switch between Light and Dark themes in Figma with just a single click! This plugin lets you leverage your design tokens using local or shared styles for seamless theme transitions.


Ensure you are following the same Name Token Convention. Ensure to create two folders called Light and Dark. Feel free to any subfolders you feel necessary ... just as long there is one for Light mode and Dark mode.


Example:

Light/Color100 -> Dark/Color100


How to use your Themed:

https://www.loom.com/share/bf36f3b1b3a44526bdd8b9a1e8a51e59



Using Local Styles:

In order use local styles be sure to setup local styles with the proper naming conventions.


Using Shared Styles:

Due to limitations in the Figma API we require you to provide an Access tokens and File Key.


Locating Figma Access tokens:

https://www.loom.com/share/89302449180d4de39748f6f8084fc5b1


Locating File Key:

https://www.loom.com/share/1a137ec463ee4510b0a79e5129e94e44



Once set up, enjoy one-click theme toggling and maintain design consistency across all your projects.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly switch between Light & Dark themes using your own design tokens

plugins.name: Bulk Desaturate: Black & White Image Fills
plugins.description:
Description

Bulk Desaturate makes it easy to convert image fills to black and white in Figma ‚Äî instantly and non-destructively. Whether you're testing tone, removing visual noise, or creating grayscale wireframes, this plugin simplifies your workflow.


How to use

  1. Select images or shapes containing image fills
  2. Choose a style
  3. Convert images


Features

  1. Supports multiple selections
  2. One-click ‚ÄúSelect All‚Äù image fills
  3. Non-destructive fill layering
  4. Optimized grayscale presets
  5. Fast and lightweight ‚Äî ideal for large files


How it works

Bulk Desaturate adds a black and white version of the original image as a new fill layer inside each selected shape. Your original image stays intact underneath, so changes are non-destructive. You can easily remove the grayscale fill by removing this new layer ‚Äî or just press Undo (Ctrl+Z / Cmd+Z) to go back instantly.


Each style (Muted, Neutral, Punchy) applies a different contrast and exposure setting, so you can match the grayscale look to your design‚Äôs mood or testing needs.


Feature requests and feedback

I have plans to make this better and make bulk image editing much easier. While I am working on that, hit me on X (@itssumeetp), via mail (itssumeetp@gmail.com), or leave a comment here.
plugins.tagline: Instantly select all images and convert to black and white. Apply grayscale styles in bulk.

plugins.name: Reset instances
plugins.description:
Reset the following properties of instances without having to reset the media and text content. Works with variables.


Everything except content

Outermost layer without content (nested instances will not be reset)

Select properties to reset


Dimensions (Width, height, or min/max dimensions)

Fit

Padding

Item spacing

Corner radius

Visibility

Modes

Typography


Note: The processing of instances will take more time to complete the larger the instances are. Hidden layers within the instances will also be processed. It is recommended to not run the plugin on more than 1 complex instance ‚Äì the plugin will timeout in 15 minutes.


This plugin does not reset texts, fills and strokes as they are supported natively in Figma via the overflow button next to the component panel.


Source code here.

plugins.name: AnnoDot
plugins.description:
AnnoDot is a flexible plugin that enhances your design workflow with dynamic, customizable annotations. The plugin allows designers to annotate their designs for better communication and clarity, with the flexibility to personalize their annotations for any project or need.


Each annotation can be edited post-creation within the plugin, ensuring information remains accurate and up-to-date. AnnoDot's refresh feature automatically updates annotation counts (at the push of a button) as designs evolve, eliminating confusion by maintaining unique identifiers for each note.


Key Highlights:


‚Ä¢ Dynamic Annotation Creation: Easily create and edit annotations directly in your Figma designs for clear communication.


‚Ä¢ Customizable Annotation Frames: Adjust frames to suit your project needs by choosing exactly what information to include in each annotation.


‚Ä¢ Annotation Count Refresh: Keep your annotation numbers unique and updated as frames are added or removed, avoiding duplicates at the push of a button.


‚Ä¢ Advanced Color Customization: Tailor the background and text colors of the annotation dot and its numbering for seamless design integration.


‚Ä¢ Visual Tags: Use a default tag for development, bug, flow, or accessibility to quickly identify the tag or add personalized tags to your annotations, choosing your label, background, and text/border colors for distinct visibility.


‚Ä¢ Enhanced Design Clarity: Improve your design workflow with informative and aesthetically pleasing annotations, which will enhance team communication and project understanding.


This was done as a passion project. I‚Äôm a designer who likes to dabble in coding. Please reach out with any issues you encounter, and I will do my best to update the plugin accordingly.
plugins.tagline: Annotate, Customize, Refresh: Design Clarity Made Easy

plugins.name: Color Contrast
plugins.description:
Measure color contrast using the APCA, BPCA, and WCAG 2 algorithms.


Inspect Mode:

  1. Select any layer‚Äîpreferably text, but frame, group, component, or instance layers also work‚Äîto automatically extract the color.
  2. Alternatively, you can manually input the color.
  3. The calculated contrast value will be displayed below.
  4. Click the "Show conformance" button at the bottom to view the WCAG conformance for the selected contrast.


Audit Mode:

  1. Select the frame to run the audit for and click run audit button.
  2. The plugin lists any contrast violations for both normal and large text.
  3. WCAG2 is the default algorithm, but you can switch to other contrast algorithm.
  4. In the list, you can click on any row to focus that layer on the canvas, you can shift + click on any row to open that layer in the inspect mode.


If you aren't familiar with the BPCA or APCA algorithms, check out this article Color contrast, a deep dive.
plugins.tagline: Measure color contrast using APCA, BPCA, WCAG 2 algorithms

plugins.name: SimpleStage
plugins.description:
Improve your client communication and speed up your website design process! SimpleStage gives you a single platform to collect content, design feedback, and website feedback.


Sync your files directly from Figma to SimpleStage and send them to your client or copywriters to provide content or leave design feedback.


Gather content from clients and stakeholders during the design process


Collecting content is one of the most difficult aspects of a creative project, but SimpleStage makes the process easier with content collection fields and automated client reminders.


  • Visual content entry
  • Customizable fields
  • Easily collaborate
  • Version history


Collect design feedback and collaborate quickly with clients


Sharing designs and collecting feedback from your clients is easy and fast with SimpleStage. Clients can comment and annotate on your uploaded design to give feedback directly on elements.


  • Speed up design review
  • Annotate designs
  • Communicate faster
  • Version history

accepted.description:
Collaboration made Simple
The complete solution to communicate with your clients at every stage of the website creation process

plugins.name: Typable
plugins.description:
Make your Figma forms work like the real thing üöÄ


Tired of static form designs? Typable transforms your Figma prototypes into fully interactive, typable experiences. With just one click, you can add input fields, validation, and a submit button, making your forms functional and testable directly inside Figma.


Typable takes full advantage of Figma‚Äôs native variable functionality, automatically setting up and managing all necessary components and variables behind the scenes. No need to manually configure anything ‚Äî just focus on designing and let Typable handle the technical details.


üî• Why use Typable?


‚úÖ Bring your prototypes to life

Let users type into input fields and interact with your forms as they would in a real product.


‚úÖ Effortless form validation

Set required fields, add custom error messages, and guide users with real-time feedback.


‚úÖ One-click setup

Instantly generate fully functional form components without complex setup or plugins.


‚úÖ Test like a pro

Get realistic usability feedback by allowing users to fill out forms and submit them inside Figma.


‚ú® Key Features


üìù Typable input fields

Add real input fields that users can type into during prototypes.


‚ö° Customizable form elements

Define labels, placeholder text, and default values.


üö® Error handling

Set mandatory fields and display custom error messages on submit.


üéØ Success feedback

Show entered values on a success screen when all fields are correctly filled.


üé® Seamless Figma integration

Works effortlessly inside your design workflow, no extra tools needed.


Upcoming updates:

  1. Adding more interactive components: textarea, checkbox, radio, toggle, dropdown
  2. Adding support for mobile keyboards
plugins.tagline: Fully typable, interactive forms in one click
